page.title: 06**MR.LEWIS REMEMBERS cont.**
page.content: Clarbeston Road. An old water pump stood on the 'island'in the road just East of the present school,at the head of the road leading to Conkland Hill. Up until about 20 years ago,the village blacksmith's shop was at Long Garden now a private house in the village. It was about this time too,that the regular bus service to Haverfordwest ceased to operate. Several farms in the area have amalgamated since the last war,with their farm houses converted to private houses.The numbers of people employed at the farms has dropped dramatically and now no-one living in the village itself works on a farm. Everyone leaves the village to go to their place of work or are retired. THE END.
